business.headline: Stocks to watch today: Swiggy, RVNL, Ola Electric, Honasa, Wipro In today's trading, shares of Ola Electric, PB Fintech, Swiggy, Honasa Consumer, Reliance Power, Wipro, and others are expected to be in focus due to important news and developments.

Credit card changes in December: 4 banks revise fees and rewardsBanks like SBI, Axis, Yes Bank, and AU Small Finance Bank are updating credit card fees, rewards, and policies in December 2024, impacting transactions, redemptions, and reward categories.

NPS Vatsalya: Key benefits, investments, and withdrawal rules explained NPS Vatsalya, launched in September, enables guardians to secure a child's financial future with regulated investments, early savings benefits, and partial withdrawal options until age 18.
Swiggy Q2 results: Net loss narrows to Rs 625.5 crore in 1st earnings after IPOSwiggy's revenue from operations rose by 30% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 3,601 crore, up from Rs 2,763 crore in Q2FY24.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as banking stocks rally; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 597.67 points to close at 80,845.75, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 181.10 points to end at 24,457.15.

Elon Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay rejected by US court againThe court upheld its earlier ruling from January, which called the compensation plan excessive and rescinded it, despite Tesla shareholders voting in June to reinstate it.

I was as explicit as I could be: Binance CEO on WazirX hackBinance CEO Changpeng Zhao addressed the WazirX hack on X, emphasising Binance's non-involvement, as users seek answers to their frozen funds.
Explained: Why HDFC Bank share price gained 2% today HDFC Bank shares rose 2% in early trade to touch a day high of Rs 1,837. At 1:34 pm, the stock was trading 1.25% higher at Rs 1,827.10.
Housing prices rise 11% across top Indian cities. Is your city on the list?The average housing price across eight major cities now stands at Rs 11,000 per square foot, according to a report.

Sensex soars over 500 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 562.95 points to reach 80,811.03 at 12:55 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 152.15 points to 24,425.85. Broader market indices also traded in the green, reflecting widespread optimism across sectors.

Why Ola Electric share price jumped today? 3 factors behind strong rally Ola Electric Stock Price: Over the past five trading sessions, Ola Electric shares have gained nearly 28%, recovering sharply from their 52-week low of Rs 66.60.

Explained: Why Swiggy share price gained in early trade todaySwiggy's share price jumped over 9% to reach a day high of Rs 542.10, marking a 39% gain over its issue price of Rs 390. At 11:07 am, the stock was trading 3.36% higher at Rs 512 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

UIDAI extends free Aadhaar updates until December 14: All you need to knowUIDAI has extended the free Aadhaar update deadline to December 14, 2024, allowing users to update key details online for free.

Explained: Why ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares fell in early trade today ITC, Godfrey Phillips stocks fell in early trade after a proposed change from the Group of Ministers (GoM) on GST rate rationalisation.

Explained: Why KPIT Technologies share price jumped 6% todayAt 10:28 am, the stock was trading 5.90% higher at Rs 1,420.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, regaining some momentum after a period of underperformance.

Gold, silver price today, December 3, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Wipro shares down 50%? Here's why some apps are showing the wrong priceWipro share price: Wipro stocks appeared down by 50%. However, the decline shown in certain brokerage platforms is not due to a genuine fall in the stock's value.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; ITC share price down 3% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 39.47 points to 80,287.55, while the NSE Nifty50 added 21.05 points to 24,297.10.

Share price of ITC, Godfrey Phillips to be in focus today. Here's why Shares of ITC and Godfrey Phillips, which derive a huge portion of their revenue from the tobacco and cigarette business, are likely to see movement based on investor reactions.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, CiplaDespite mixed signals, several stocks such as Adani Power, Wipro, Swiggy, Tata Power, Cipla are expected to be in focus today due to key news and developments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 12 hours that shook South Korea: Martial law imposed, overturned and lifted. A timelineIn an emergency late-night session, 190 of 300 lawmakers from both ruling and opposition parties unanimously voted to reject the martial law.

Key BJP meet in Mumbai today, Mahayuti leaders to stake claim to form governmentThe crucial BJP legislature party meeting comes ahead of the swearing in of a new Mahayuti government in Maharashtra on Thursday, with the BJP's Devendra Fadnavis likely to take over as Chief Minister.

Why no dialogue with farmers, Jagdeep Dhankar asks Shivraj Chouhan on stageDrawing a parallel to Sardar Patel's efforts in unifying India, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar called on Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan to prioritise addressing farmers' concerns, emphasising that their resolution is as crucial as the nation's unification.

Apple Watch gets help for Indian entrepreneur after car crash in USAn Indian entrepreneur claimed that his Apple Watch called for emergency help after his car crashed on a highway in the US. Kuldeep Dhankar said after his car was rear-ended, his Apple Watch detected the impact and called 911, prompting emergency response.
Video: Asteroid collides with Earth, explodes above RussiaThe object, detected around 12 hours prior to impact, generated a dazzling fireball that was witnessed by numerous residents in the region.

Comedian Sunil Pal missing after show, wife files complaint with Mumbai PoliceSunil Pal's wife tried to contact him several times and when she couldn't get in touch with him, she filed a missing person complaint.

64-year-old US woman, looking for her cat, feared swallowed by sinkholeElizabeth Pollard, 64, has been missing since going out Monday evening to search for Pepper, her cat. Police found Pollard's car near a restaurant and her 5-year-old granddaughter was found safe inside the car.

6mm grass, rain on Day 1: Adelaide pitch curator talks conditions for 2nd TestAdelaide pitch curator Damian Hough has confirmed that they are trying to make the wicket as balanced as possible. Hough has confirmed that the pitch will have 6mm of grass and under the right conditions the ball will swing and seam.
Exclusive: Honda Amaze 2024 revealed in detailed images ahead of launchWe are bringing exclusive 2024 Honda Amaze images for you before the car is launched on December 4.
University of Bath School of Management: A Leader in Global Business EducationCombining top-ranked MSc programmes with practical knowledge for future corporate leaders.

Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita Dhulipala wedding live updates: Allu Arjun to attendNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala will get married today, December 14, in Hyderabad. The intimate wedding ceremony will see family members and close friends in attendance.

Namibia elects Nandi-Ndaitwah as country's first female PresidentNandi-Ndaitwah received roughly 57 per cent of valid votes in the presidential race, according to a breakdown given by the Electoral Commission of Namibia.

No 3D release for Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 on December 5Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule will not release in 3D on December 5. According to reports, the 3D version will release at a later date.

Congress criticises PM with 'voodoo economics' jibe over slowing GDP growthCongress leader Supriya Shrinate said that PM Modi's "voodoo economic policies" put India in the middle of a vicious economic cycle of low growth, no jobs, low income and high prices.

Man indicted for Nepali-origin wife's murder in US, googled when he could remarryA 37-year-old man has been indicted by a Virginia grand jury for the murder of his 28-year-old wife. Naresh Bhatt also faces charges of defiling and concealing the body of Mamta Kafle Bhatt, a nurse. Months after she went missing, Bhatt googled to find out when he could remarry.

Trump's lawyers urge judge to toss hush money case, cite Biden pardoning sonIn urging Justice Juan Merchan in Manhattan to vacate the guilty verdict and toss the charges, Donald Trump's lawyers said having Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg's case hang over him after he takes office on January 20 would impede his ability to govern.

Pie heist in UK, Michelin-star chef urges thieves to donate loot: It's ChristmasA British chef, Tommy Banks, urged the thieves who stole his van loaded with 2,500 pies worth £25,000 (approximately Rs 27 lakh) to donate the loot.

HIV-positive man's mutilated body found in Delhi, private parts chopped offAccording to the police, the 25-year-old victim was married, but chats on his phone revealed that he was in a relationship with a man.

Kevin Pietersen's advice to struggling Prithvi Shaw: Get off social mediaFormer England cricketer Kevin Pietersen has advised the struggling India youngster Prithvi Shaw to get off social media  and start training to regain fitness.

Video: Bike catches fire after truck runs over it, rider gets injuredThe collision caused the motorcycle to catch fire and burn completely. The rider, identified as Dasharath, sustained serious injuries and was rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

Vikrant Massey says not retiring, post misinterpreted: Acting is all I can doActor Vikrant Massey clarified that his recent announcement was not a retirement statement but a break to focus on family and health. He assured fans of his return when the time feels right.

Bangladesh summons Indian envoy over breach of its mission in AgartalaBangladesh had lodged a strong protest against the alleged vandalism of its mission in Tripura's Agartala by a group of demonstrators.

Navy set to finalise Rs 60,000 crore Rafale M deal: All about game-changing jetsThe Rafale M, a naval version of the Rafale fighter jet, is designed specifically for carrier-based operations. The Rs 60,000 crore project includes maintenance and logistics support for the Rafale M fleet and training programs for Navy personnel on operating and maintaining the jets.

4 girls accidentally consume pesticide while playing 'doctor-doctor' in Rajathan The incident occurred around 5 pm when a 10-year-old boy, a relative of the girls, gave them pesticide used for spraying on cotton crops as part of the game.

Allu Arjun's fans get special emoji on X ahead of Pushpa 2 releaseAhead of Pushpa 2: The Rule release, the makers launched special emojis on X, featuring Allu Arjun's iconic pose. The film is scheduled to hit theatres on December 5.

Sunil Pal speaks to police, wife confirms after filing missing reportComedian Sunil Pal, who went missing for hours after leaving Mumbai for a show, was later found safe. His wife confirmed that he had spoken to the police.

No 3D release for Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 on December 5Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule will not release in 3D on December 5. According to reports, the 3D version will release at a later date.

Taijul Islam stars as Bangladesh draw series with 101-run win in 2nd TestBangladesh secured a historic victory in the Caribbean, defeating the West Indies by 101 runs at Sabina Park to draw the Test series. This marked their first Test win in the West Indies in 15 years.

Who is Sufiyan Muqeem? Pakistan's mystery spinner who scripted history vs ZIMPakistan's young spinner Sufiyan Muqeem etched his name in record books with his record-breaking spell in the 2nd T20I vs Zimbabwe. Here's all you need to know about Pakistan's rising star.

Rohit Sharma pulls off double duty in nets in Adelaide before pink-ball TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma pulled off a double shift in the nets in Adelaide ahead of the pink-ball Test on Tuesday, December 3. The Indian team had a 4-hour net session ahead of the match on Tuesday.

United are currently unbeaten under Amorim in all competitions.

D Gukesh laments fumble in Game 7, happy to outplay Ding Liren from startIndian grandmaster D Gukesh admitted disappointment at missing out on a golden chance to win Game 7 of the World Chess Championship against Ding Liren on Tuesday, December 3. Gukesh's fumble allowed Liren to save himself and salvage a draw.

Sense over stature: Manjrekar predicts Rohit Sharma to sacrifice opening spotSanjay Manjrekar predicted that Rohit Sharma might sacrifice his opening spot to KL Rahul, appreciating the latter's resilience in Perth, as India strategise for their second Test in Adelaide amidst a crowded and competitive batting lineup.

Muqeem demolishes Zimbabwe for 57, sets up 10-wicket win for Pakistan in 2nd T20IPakistan beat Zimbabwe by ten wickets in the second T20I of the three-match series as Sufiyan Muqeem registered best bowling figures by a Pakistan bowler in T20Is.

Arjun Erigaisi reflects on early drawbacks, points out the change in approachIndian grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi discusses his growth journey, overcoming early setbacks in his style. Erigaisi revealed the changes he made to his game play as the World No.4 is all set to take part in the Norway Chess tournament next year.

New CSK man Shreyas Gopal dismisses Hardik for 0 during SMAT hattrickShreyas Gopal's hat-trick against Baroda, including dismissing both Pandya brothers for golden ducks, showcased his brilliance and sparked excitement amongst Chennai Super Kings fans ahead of IPL 2025, where he is set to play at Chepauk.

Maybe he knows more about City's 115 charges: Slot jokes about Salah's commentLiverpool manager Arne Slot made light of Mohamed Salah's comments regarding his future after the win over Manchester City. Slot also joked about City's 115 legal charges, emphasizing it was just a jest.

NZ vs ENG: New Zealand, England hit with World Test Championship points deductionNew Zealand and England face penalties for slow over-rates in the World Test Championship 2023-25, impacting their standings. New Zealand's qualification hopes now hinge on winning remaining matches and favorable outcomes elsewhere.
Indian squash legend Raj Manchanda dies at 79 in New DelhiLegendary India squash player Raj Manchanda, the Arjuna Award recipient and winner of six national titles died at the age of 79 in New Delhi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
